results.title: The Dogfish as a vertebrate
results.brief_description: Deals with the Dogfish as a typical vertebrate, illustrating its anatomy in detail. Comparisons with four other types are given; i.e., with newt, lizard, bird and rabbit. Fishes, amphibians, reptiles, birds and mammals included in vertebrates; basic plan demonstrated by Dogfish. Alimentary canal has mouth, oesophagus, stomach, intestinal colonic regions; liver and pancreas; also central nervous system, sense organs. Detail from Dogfish; comparisons in the other four types (frog, lizard, bird and rabbit). Skeleton - axial and appendicular - common to all. Respiratory system involves large surfaces for oxygenation of blood - gills, lungs. Ventral position of heart; plans of blood systems. Gills as embryonic vestiges. Urinogenital systems association. Sexual reproduction and separate sexes common to vertebrates; detail for Dogfish (internal fertilization), Frog (external fertilization).

results.title: The Doctor
results.brief_description: Members of the medical profession may specialise in one or perhaps more of the hundreds of branches of medical science, according to their own choice and ability. This doctor is a children’s specialist - a pediatrician - and the film is designed to show both parents and children what a typical day’s work is like for him, in a big hospital, and at his private consulting rooms.

results.title: The division of radiophysics
results.brief_description: Describes the current research work being undertaken by the CSIRO division of Radiophysics, including radio astronomy, moon echoes, radar meteorology, radio-controlled models, rain making, electronic computing, radar aids to navigation, aids to airport control, and upper air investigations.

results.title: The Divided man: commitment or compromise
results.creator_credit: Milosaw Kijawicz, Film Polski, Miniature Film Studio and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: An animated film which proves the maxim that one cannot travel two roads at the same time without being diminished. Vascillating from side to side, a man struggles to make a decision. In an effort to make the “perfect” choice he divides himself and travels two paths. However when his two halves attempt to reunite one half has shrunk.

results.title: The Distant lens
results.creator_credit: Glenda Hambly, Owen Paterson, Paul D. Barron and Perth Institute of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Looks at the past of Western Australia, taking the audience through a kaleidoscope of events, including two wars, Royal visits, the Group Settlement, the first aeroplane flights, and the 1920 centenary parades. Composed of photographs and archive film.

results.title: The Discovery of television
results.creator_credit: John Lloyd, Alasdair Milne, BBC-TV and JBM Productions
results.brief_description: The discovery and development of television is not the story of the efforts of a single person, but of many people. It is a search through a tangled web of scientific discoveries, inventions, and developments, of ideas tried and rejected and tried again, culminating with the efforts of an enthusiastic team of professionals led by Sir Isaac Shoenberg. Describes the early experiments in television leading to the first regular broadcasts from London beginning on 2nd November 1936. The work of the pioneers is reconstructed using contemporary records and interviews.

results.title: The Directors
results.brief_description: A ‘Life Magazine’ reporter attempts to analyse the traits of a good director, talking to such noted directors as David Lean, Igmar Bergman, Kurosawa, Fellini and Hitchcock. Discusses the evolution of neo-realism, the technical advances that have brought about cinema verite and the New Wave directors and their influence.

results.title: The Director
results.brief_description: Director Don Weis bears the responsibility of supervising every aspect of putting a film together. His talent must encompass acting, camera work, special effects, music, costumes, make-up, scripts, editing and budgeting. This film places the viewer beside a skilful director as he gives shape to a major Hollywood production. Features Robert Wagner in acting role.

results.title: The Dinosaur who wondered who he was
results.brief_description: Diplodocus, who has a lot to learn about the world, saves himself and his friends Stegosaur, Brontosaur and Pterodactyl from the terrible Allosaur in Murky Swamp.

results.title: The Dinosaur age
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Film Associates of California
results.brief_description: Describes the work of two palaeontologists looking for fossils on a rocky hillside. They uncover the paddle or flipper of a plesiosaur which was a large water living reptile or sea serpent closely related to dinosaurs. The methods used to uncover the bones, preserve them, and transport them to a museum are shown, also the tedious work of assembling the bones, fitting them in position and reconstructing the entire animals are explained. Models of representative animals of the age of dinosaurs are shown.
